Ru_trainchinese:
jìn: (глаг) исчерпывать; использовать полностью; стараться изо всех сил
jìn: (нареч) полностью, целиком, все, сплошь; вполне, совершенно
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the dish (皿) has a brush (聿) with fire (灬) and gets exhausted
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: After a long day of ruling the ruler ices his exhausted knees.
humanum_full_description_en:
Oracle changes from " again " from ◎ (like a brush) from " dish ", like cleaning the utensils after eating and drinking, the original meaning is eating and drinking. The extension means end and end.

There are two fonts in bronze inscriptions. The first type carries the oracle bone inscriptions, which is like washing a basin with a brush; the second type is like the brush part of the brush is turned into a fire, like burning things in a basin, just like today’s treasure basin It is the first article of the " ember " of ashes and embers. "Said Wen": "Hey, the fire is over."

Oracle is used as a person's name. The inscription means exhaustion, Zhongshan Wang Fanghu: "Thirst (exhaustion) of loyalty, so that you can help you, but not your heart." It also expresses completeness, and Shang Yang said: "Twenty-six years, the emperor will conquer the world." Qin Shihuang completely unified the world.

"Shuowen": "Exhaust, the vessel is hollow. From the pan, the sound."
humanum_short_description_en: Oracle changed from " again " from ◎ (like a brush) from " dish ", like washing utensils after eating and drinking, the original meaning is eating and drinking. The extension means end and end.
humanum_full_description:
甲骨文從「又」從◎(象刷子)從「皿」，象飲食完畢清洗器皿，本義是飲食完畢。引申表示終了、完結的意思。

　　金文有兩種字形，第一種上承甲骨文，象手拿刷子清洗盆子；第二種字形象刷子的部分訛變為火，象在盆中燒物之形，猶如今天的化寶盆，是灰燼、餘燼的「燼」的初文。《說文》：「㶳，火餘也。」

　　甲骨文用作人名。金文表示竭盡，中山王方壺：「渴(竭)志盡忠，以佐佑厥闢，不貳其心。」又表示完全，商鞅量：「廿六年，皇帝盡并兼天下」，指秦始皇完全統一天下。

　　《說文》：「盡，器中空也。从皿，㶳聲。」
humanum_short_description: 甲骨文從「又」從◎(象刷子)從「皿」，象飲食完畢清洗器皿，本義是飲食完畢。引申表示終了、完結的意思。

①(盡原爲“盡”的俗字；今爲“盡”的簡化字。會意。甲骨文字形表示手持刷子洗刷器皿。盛東西的器皿只有空了才能洗刷。本義：器物中空)。
②用本義。［合］盡觴(飲盡杯中之酒)；盡光(精光。全無剩餘)。

甲骨文從「 又 」從◎(象刷子)從「 皿 」，象飲食完畢清洗器皿，本義是飲食完畢。引申表示終了、完結的意思。 金文有兩種字形，第一種上承甲骨文，象手拿刷子清洗盆子；第二種字形象刷子的部分訛變為火，象在盆中燒物之形，猶如今天的化寶盆，是灰燼、餘燼的「 燼 」的初文。《說文》：「㶳，火餘也。」 甲骨文用作人名。金文表示竭盡，中山王方壺：「渴(竭)志盡忠，以佐佑厥闢，不貳其心。」又表示完全，商鞅量：「廿六年，皇帝盡并兼天下」，指秦始皇完全統一天下。 《說文》：「盡，器中空也。从皿，㶳聲。」
Oracle changes from " again" from ◎ (like a brush) from " dish", like cleaning the utensils after eating and drinking, the original meaning is eating and drinking. The extension means end and end. There are two fonts in bronze inscriptions. The first type carries the oracle bone inscriptions, which is like washing a basin with a brush; the second type is like the brush part of the brush is turned into a fire, like burning things in a basin, just like today’s treasure basin It is the first article of the " ember" of ashes and embers. "Said Wen": "Hey, the fire is over." Oracle is used as a person's name. The inscription means exhaustion, Zhongshan Wang Fanghu: "Thirst (exhaustion) of loyalty, so that you can help you, but not your heart." It also expresses completeness, and Shang Yang said: "Twenty-six years, the emperor will conquer the world." Qin Shihuang completely unified the world. "Shuowen": "Exhaust, the vessel is hollow. From the pan, the sound."

盡字的基本解释

盡
jìn
见“尽1”。

盡字的汉语字典释义

[①]［jìn］
［《廣韻》慈忍切，上軫，從。］
(1)空；空无。
(2)竭尽；完。
(3)止；终。
(4)农历月终。古以农历月终三十日为大尽，二十九日为小尽。参见“大盡”、“小盡”。
(5)死。
(6)指处死。
(7)达到极限。
(8)全部；整个。
(9)犹同，一律。
(10)全部使出。
(11)努力完成。
(12)通“賮”。财货。
(13)通“燼”。
(14)姓。宋有尽言。见明凌迪知《万姓统谱·轸》。
[②]［jǐn］
［《廣韻》即忍切，上軫，精。］
同“儘1”。
(1)尽可能；尽量。
(2)任凭；听任。
(3)纵令；即使。
(4)尽自；总是。

盡字的康熙字典解释

【午集中】【皿字部】　盡； 康熙笔画：14； 页码：页795第22
【唐韻】【正韻】慈忍切【集韻】【韻會】在忍切，?秦上聲。【說文】器中空也。【小爾雅】止也。【玉篇】終也。【廣韻】竭也。【集韻】悉也。【易·繫辭】書不盡言，言不盡意。【左傳·哀元年】去惡莫如盡。【穀梁傳·定十年】孔子歷階而上，不盡一等。【禮·曲禮】君子不盡人之歡。【中庸】天地之道，可一言而盡也。【史記·禮書】明者，禮之盡也。【荀子·正名篇】欲雖不可盡，可以近盡也。【註】適可而止也。　又【韓鄂歲華紀麗】大酺小盡。【註】月三十日爲大盡，二十九日爲小盡。　又姓。見【萬姓統譜】。　又【唐韻】【正韻】卽忍切【集韻】【韻會】子忍切，?津上聲。【類篇】極也。【正韻】盡之也。【書·康誥】往盡乃心。【詩·小雅】孔惠孔時，維其盡之。【左傳·閔二年】晉侯使太子申生伐東山皋落氏，曰：盡敵而反。【禮·樂記】殷周之?盡矣。　又【韻會】皆也。【左傳·昭二年】韓宣子曰：周禮盡在魯矣。　又【類篇】任也。【增韻】縱令也。【左傳·文十四年】公子商人，盡其家貸於公。【禮·曲禮】虛坐盡後，

Exhausted
Basic explanation of words
Exhausted
jìn
See "Exhaust 1".
Exhausted
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［jìn］
["Guangyun" Compassionate, patience, Shang Zhen, Cong. ]
(1) Empty; empty.
(2) Exhaustion; End.
(3) End; end.
(4) The end of the lunar month. In ancient times, the 30th day of the end of the lunar month was the big end, and the 29th day was the small end. See "big end", "small end".
(5) Die.
(6) Refers to execution.
(7) Reach the limit.
(8) All; whole.
(9) The same, the same.
(10) All use.
(11) Efforts to complete.
(12) Tong "賮". Property.
(13) Through "Jin".
(14) Last name. Song has everything to say. See Ming Ling Di knows "The Genealogy of Wan Xing·Zhen".
[②]［jǐn］
["Guangyun" means patience and cutting, Shangzhen and Jing. ]
Same as "Exhaust 1".
(1) As far as possible; as far as possible.
(2) Let alone; let alone.
(3) Indulgence; even.
(4) Do your own thing; always.

[Guliang Biography·Ding Ten Years] Confucius went up in steps, and there was no end. 【Rituals·Courtesy】A gentleman is inexhaustible. 【The Doctrine of the Mean】The way of heaven and earth can be stated in one word. 【Historical Records·Book of Rites】The Ming is the end of rituals. 【Xunzi·Rectification of Names】Although your desires are inexhaustible, they can be nearly exhausted. [Note] Just enough.　[Han E Sui Hua Ji Li] The big devil is small. [Note] The 30th is the end of the month, and the 29th is the end of the small.　Another last name.
